chapter.title: Common Errors
chapter.para: Tchk is capable of performing a number of checks for common programming mistakes. This chapter describes these checks and controlling pragmas.

section.title: Enumerations controlling switch statements
section.para: Enumerations are commonly used as control expressions in switch statements. When case labels for some of the enumeration constant belonging to the enumeration type do not exist and there is no default label, the switch statement has no effect for certain possible values of the control expression. section.title: Variable shadowing
section.para: It is quite legal in C to have a variable in an inner scope, with the same name as a variable in an outer scope. These variables are distinct and whilst in the inner scope, the declaration in the outer scope is not visible - it is shadowed by the local variable of the same name. Confusion can arise if this was not what the programmer intended. If status is on an error is raised when a local variable that shadows another variable is declared, if warning is used the error is replaced by a warning and the off option restores the default behaviour (shadowing is permitted and no errors are produced).
